message:
I wonder what a Javascript developer do ? Is it another title for UI Developer ?

And if not, Is this role even exists in Egypt ?

data.message: you can work as cross platform developer or Ui developer , ui developer available in egypt
If nodeJS went mainstream they'll be the richest guys in town =D
Mohammed Ragab I really don't prefer working as a UI developer.. I don't like tinkering with the design side a lot :D
Muhammad Negm I was thinking about Nodejs development yes!
Also if you're working with single page apps you're going to need either a UI dev with excellent JS knowledge or a JS dev
I worked before on a SPA as a hobby..  Used AngularJS with Nodejs..  But ended up with minimum visuals.. Since I know nothing about advanced styling techniques

meen byes2al 3alayya? :D
I have been a  pure JS developer for a Year now. I'm originally a PHP develoer but I started writing JS applications for IPTV frameworks that run on linux based set-top boxes that uses SVG instead of HTML.
I got stuck with this and PHP is slowly fading away except for backend purposes.
Now, I'm kinda lost in a very ,VERY specific area and this sucks :(
However, I love what I do because I've always loved JS but hated Photoshop, css and other Frontenderz stuff :)

w law 7ad ye3raf yla2ely shoghlana barra el balad de enshallah f Mozambique yeb2a keseb feyya sawab kbeeeeer
#bgd

Ahmad Gamal El Din We're really alike!  I'm a php developer too..  Love JS. And hate front end stuff (except js related)..  From what I understand from what you said..  There are no many places that have pure js developers..  Always with a front-end flavor?

I didn't look to be honest. It started with a task that turned out to be my future career
I didn't choose JS life. JS life chose me :D

Ahmad Gamal El Din ,  Rafael Adel 
Me too i love JS more than PHP , in the same time i hate PS & CSS and every thing related to photos :D
mobile app development, with Apache Cordova, you will be able to do cross-platform (Android, iOS, Windows) development through JS

It's not Egypt specific. It's exactly as you guessed, another word to say UI developer, unless they work with Node for their backend, then they probably mean a full stack JavaScript developer, which is not specific to Egypt as well.

Ahmad Gamal El Din Rafael Adel
If you're looking for jobs
https://trello.com/jobs
http://www.google.com/about/careers/
http://careers.stackoverflow.com/
https://jobs.github.com/

Some of them allow you to work remotely
when it comes to SPAs he rules :)
